full.text: <pointer>, [looks at pointer] can you explain this?

repeat.text: Can you explain this, [looks at pointer] <pointer>?

full.text: <assistant>, [looks at assistant] could you please explain this?

repeat.text: Could you please explain this, [looks at assistant] <assistant>?

full.text: No, [shakes head] I didn’t learn that yet.

repeat.text: [head shaking] I haven't learned that yet.

full.text: Hmmmmm. [thinking body language] Sorry, [head shaking] I don’t remember.

repeat.text: Sorry, [head shaking] I don’t remember.

full.text: Well. [thinking body language] I don’t think I know this. [disappointed]

repeat.text: [thinking body language] I don’t know this. [disappointed]

full.text: [thank you body movement] Thank you.

repeat.text: [thank you body movement] Thanks.

full.text: Oh! [hands up startled] [sorry body language] I am sorry.

repeat.text: [sorry body language] Sorry!

full.text: [nodding] Yes.

repeat.text: [nodding[ Yes.

repeat.text: [shaking head] No.

full.text: [Redo previous one] [excited body language] Oh sure!

repeat.text: [Redo previous one] [excited body language] Sure!

full.text: [head turn to dog] <dog> is barking [hands up in the air startled]! [looks to owner] <owner>, [question body language] do you think <dog> needs a break? [question body language] Or I can provide a treat to [looks at dog] <dog> to see if that helps.

repeat.text: <owner>, does [question body language] <dog> need a break? I can provide a treat to [look at dog] <dog>.

full.text: Ok.

full.text: [thank you body movement] Thanks.

repeat.text: [thank you body movement] Thank you.

full.text: [body language] Please only release <dog> after I say 'ok.'

repeat.text: [body language] Only release <dog> when I say 'ok.'

full.text: [look at dog] <dog>, look [head dip down looking at treat]! [head look up toward dog] I got a treat for you.

repeat.text: [look at dog] I got a treat for you, <dog>.

full.text: [happy body language] Looks like <dog> is fine now. [wave hand] Let’s continue.

repeat.text: [happy body language] <dog> looks fine. [wave hand] Let’s continue now.

full.text: [body language] Maybe <dog> [looks at dog] need a break.

repeat.text: [looks at dog] <dog> [body language] may need a break.

full.text: Ok.

full.text: Ok.

full.text: [nb|waving] Hello. [welcoming hand gesture] Welcome back to the dog lab!

repeat.text: [nb|waving] Welcome back to the dog lab!

full.text: [nb|point to self]I am Niffi.

repeat.text: [nb|point to self} My name is Niffi.

full.text: And [look at and point] this is <pointer>.

repeat.text: [look at and point] this is <pointer>.

full.text: [b|stand] She needs to stay quiet [nb|quiet gesture] for now by the design of this study. [b|stand] But she is friendly.

repeat.text: [b|stand] <pointer> needs to stay quiet [nb|quiet gesture] for now.

full.text: [nb|reach out hand questioning gesture] May I have your name? [b|stand].

repeat.text: [nb|reach out hand questioning gesture] Can you please tell me your name?[b|stand]

full.text: And [looks toward dog] who is this? Could you please let me know [points to dog] your dog’s name?

repeat.text: [looks toward dog] may I have your dog's name?

full.text: [thank you body language] Thank you.

repeat.text: [thank you body language] Thanks.

full.text: Is <dog> [point toward dog] [questioning gesture] a girl or a boy?

repeat.text: What gender is [point toward dog] <dog>?

full.text: Nice to meet you! [welcoming hand gesture]

repeat.text: Glad to meet you! [welcoming hand gesture]

full.text: Please [point toward chair] take a seat.

repeat.text: Feel free to take a seat [point toward chair].

full.text: <dog> can be [gestures toward room] anywhere.

repeat.text: <dog> can move [gestures toward room] anywhere in the room.

full.text: [body language] This is the first study I’ve been involved in to work with dogs.

repeat.text: [body language] This is my first study working with dogs.

full.text: We have worked with a few dogs so far, [hold out hands] but I am still relatively new in the dog lab.

repeat.text: We have already worked with a few dogs, [holds out hands] but I am still new to the lab.

full.text: Most dogs I’ve seen are ok with me [point toward self]. But please [holds out hand] let me know if you think <dog> [waves toward dog] gets scared.

repeat.text: Please let me [point toward self] know if <dog> gets scared.

full.text: [hands up] I will now introduce [point toward self] myself [puts hand down].

repeat.text: I will introduce [point toward self] myself now [puts hand down].

full.text: I [points hand at itself] am a female.

repeat.text: I [points hand at itself] am a female.

full.text: [waves hands/body language] And I am an adult!

repeat.text: [waves hands/body language] I am also an adult!

full.text: [talking motion] I have worked at the Social Robotics Lab at Yale [wave toward room] for a couple of years.

repeat.text: [talking motion] I work at the Social Robotics Lab at Yale [wave toward room].

full.text: After this study is done, [talking motion] I can talk more about what studies [point toward self] I was involved in. Let’s now focus on [point down toward floor] this study.

repeat.text: Let's focus on this study now.

full.text: I am so excited [excited arm swing] to play with <dog> [holds out hands toward dog] today!

repeat.text: I am very excited [excited arm swing] to play with <dog> [holds out hands toward dog] today!

full.text: Before we start, [talking motion] I have a few questions for you [point toward person].

repeat.text: May I ask a few questions [point toward person]?

full.text: Does <dog> know the command 'sit'?

repeat.text: Does <dog> know 'sit'?

full.text: Can you let <dog> sit?

repeat.text: Can you ask <dog> to sit?

full.text: Good <dog gender>!

repeat.text: Good <dog gender>!

full.text: Let’s try one more time.

repeat.text: Let's try again.

full.text: That’s fine. Maybe <dog> is shy today! Let’s move on.

repeat.text: That's fine. Let's move on.

full.text: That’s totally fine. <dog> doesn’t need to know this command to participate in the study.

repeat.text: That's completely fine. <dog> doesn't need to know 'sit' for this study.

full.text: Does <dog> do any tricks?

repeat.text: Does <dog> know any tricks?

full.text: I am excited to see that. Could you please show them to me?

repeat.text: Could <dog> show them to me?

full.text: Impressive!

repeat.text: Wow!

full.text: That's great!

repeat.text: Amazing!

full.text: <dog> is so smart!

repeat.text: Incredible!

full.text: How old is <dog>?

repeat.text: What age is <dog>?

full.text: So <dog> is still young.

repeat.text: <dog> is very young

full.text: Wow, <dog> looks so young.

repeat.text: <dog> still looks very young

full.text: What kind of dog is <dog> as in breed?

repeat.text: What breed is <dog>?

full.text: How long have you been with <dog>?

repeat.text: How many years have you been with <dog>?

full.text: That’s not too long, but I believe you will have a great time with <dog>.

repeat.text: Sounds like you two will have many adventures in the future.

full.text: You’ve been with each other for quite some time.

repeat.text: That's a really long time. You two must be very close.

full.text: Do you have other dogs at home?

repeat.text: Do you have any other dogs?

full.text: It must feel great to be the only child in the family to get all the treat and toys.

repeat.text: Being an only child must be great!

full.text: It is great to have other dogs to play with at home.

repeat.text: It must be fun to have so many dog friends at home.

full.text: Is <dog> food motivated?

repeat.text: Is <dog> motivated by food?

full.text: That’s great! <dog> will get a lot treats today.

repeat.text: That's great!

full.text: Let’s see what <dog> will do today.

repeat.text: Let’s see what <dog> can do today.

full.text: Has <dog> ever interacted with a robot before? Like roomba, or robot toys?

repeat.text: Has <dog> ever interacted with robots before?

full.text: Good know to <dog> loves robots!

repeat.text: Good to know <dog> likes to play with robots!

full.text: I hope <dog> will like me then.

repeat.text: I hope <dog> likes me then.

full.text: Now I will explain this study a little bit. [talking motions]

repeat.text: I will explain how this study works [talking motions].

full.text: <dog> will have some time to get familiar with this environment, and me! Hopefully <dog> likes me.

repeat.text: <dog> will be able to explore the environment, and me, for a period of time.

full.text: Afterwards, <dog> will get a treat from me.

repeat.text: After exploring, I will give <dog> a treat.

full.text: In this study, we will explore how dogs understand pointing.

repeat.text: This study explores how dogs understand pointing.

full.text: There will be two warmup sessions, one with me leading and one with <pointer> leading.

repeat.text: We will have two warmup sessions, one with me and one with <pointer>.

full.text: The warmup sessions will be followed by two testing sessions, also one with me and one with <pointer>.

repeat.text: We will have two more testing sessions after the warmup sessions.

full.text: Between each session, you and <dog> will get a quick break in the lobby so we can get set up for the next session.

repeat.text: You and <dog> will get a quick break in the lobby between sessions.

full.text: Also please let us know at any point if you think <dog> needs a break!

repeat.text: Please let us now any time during the sessions if you think <dog> needs a break!

full.text: Now <dog> will have 1 minute to get familiar with this environment.

repeat.text: <dog> will have 1 minute to get familiar with the environment.

full.text: And feel free to let <dog> explore around the room. [motions out toward room]

repeat.text: Feel free to allow <dog> to explore the room. [motions out toward room]

full.text: Now let’s start!

repeat.text: Let's start!

full.text: <dog>, come over!

repeat.text: Come over here <dog>!

full.text: Hi <dog>!

repeat.text: Hi <dog>!

full.text: Hello <dog>!

repeat.text: Hello <dog>!

full.text: Hope we can be buddies!

repeat.text: Hope we can be buddies!

full.text: How are you!

repeat.text: How are you!

full.text: I am so excited to play with you today!

repeat.text: I am so excited to play with you today!

full.text: Time is up! Now I will provide a treat to <dog>.

repeat.text: Exploration time is done! Now I will give <dog> a treat.

full.text: <owner>, please bring <dog> closer to you.

repeat.text: Bring <dog> closer to you please.

full.text: [look to <pointer>] <pointer>, can you bring over the dispenser.

repeat.text: [look to <pointer>] bring me the dispenser please, <pointer>.

full.text: This is the container that we will use in this study to provide <dog> the treat.

repeat.text: We will use this container to provide <dog> treats.

full.text: Thank you. Can you bring me the spoon and the treat?

repeat.text: Can you give me the spoon and treat?

full.text: Ok.

full.text: Nice! We will now prepare for the warm-up session. Could you please take <dog> to the lobby?

repeat.text: Can you please take <dog> to the lobby while we prepare for the warm-up session?

full.text: There will be a lot of back and forth from this room and the lobby in this study. Sorry about that in advance! Thanks, see you soon!

repeat.text: You will be moving between this room and the lobby many times during the study. Sorry in advance! Thanks, see you soon!

full.text: Hi! Welcome back.

repeat.text: Welcome back!

full.text: Please take a seat.

repeat.text: Take a seat, please.

full.text: And please let <dog> sit in the black square.

repeat.text: <dog> can sit in the black square.

full.text: Please keep your head down and eyes closed during each trial. Please only look ahead when you hear me say 'ok.'

repeat.text: Please keep your head down and eyes closed during each trial until I say 'ok.'

full.text: Remember, when you hear the release command 'ok,' you can let <dog> get a treat.

repeat.text: Only release <dog> when you hear the release command 'ok.'

full.text: If <dog> hesitates to make a choice after the release command, feel free to give <him/her> a release command of your own, but try not to point or give <dog> a directional hint.

repeat.text: If <dog> hesitates after I say 'ok,' you can give <him/her> a release command of your own, but try not to point.

full.text: Please let <dog> go back to you after <he/she> gets the treat, and please do not let <dog> go to the other container.

repeat.text: Let <dog> return to you after the treat, but don't let <him/her> go to the other container.

full.text: Let’s start!

repeat.text: Let’s start!

full.text: You will get it next time.

full.text: Hope you will get treat in the next session.

repeat.text: Hope you will get the treat next time.

repeat.text: Take <dog> back please for the next trial.

full.text: Let's move on to the next trial!

repeat.text: Let's start the next trial!

full.text: <dog> can take another break. <owner>, please take <dog> to the lobby and we will prepare for the next session.

full.text: Please keep your head down and eyes closed during each trial. Please only look ahead when you hear me say 'ok.'

repeat.text: Please keep your head down and eyes closed during each trial until I say 'ok.'

full.text: The testing session is longer than the warmup, so please let me know if you think <dog> is tired and needs a break.

full.text: Ok, let’s continue. <assistant>, can you check the two dispensers?
